I feel that one of the FAQ answers in the JUnit documentation could be made
clearer to people like me who don't have much experience with
getResourceAsStream().

The question is FAQ question #5, "I get a ClassNotFoundException when I use
the LoadingTestRunner".

The bottom of the answer says:

  If you are using additional jars from 3rd party vendors you can either:

  . update this file in the junit.jar and add your package paths or,

  . "patch" the junit.util.excluded.properties file with the CLASSPATH,
    that is, put your customized version of this file in the class path
    before the junit.jar. In this way your version will be loaded instead
    of the one that comes with junit.

Adding the following to the last bullet point would have saved me a bunch of
time:

  For example, if you put your properties in a directory called:

    /home/properties/

  then add:

    /home/properties/

  to your classpath and create a file called:

    /home/properties/junit/util/excluded.properties

  Adding the following file WILL NOT WORK:

    /home/properties/excluded.properties




Erik
subject: Documentation change suggestion
